body:
> How about conditionally adding Maven argument as [done for some products in do-component-build](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/blob/04830bd46ac4bf3cd607760b91be65a73c6579ba/bigtop-packages/src/common/hbase/do-component-build#L23-L55) instead of using `.mvn/maven.config`? We can access vars in bigtop.bom via environment variables.

@iwasakims 
I've reconsidered your approach and there's something I don't quite understand. What you're suggesting is:

The user compiles with a parallel compilation parameter, like compileThreads.
This parameter is then defined as an environmental variable.
Next, in the spec file or control file, this variable is passed to the do-component script for processing.
What's the benefit of this approach? It seems like it would lead to extensive, invasive code changes, requiring modifications to the do-component scripts and either the spec or control scripts of all involved components.

I have another idea:
We could save the mvn patch file in the template directory. For components that support concurrent compilation, we can simply copy it over. To determine which components support concurrent compilation, we might need to add an attribute in the bigtop.bom file to mark those components that support this feature.
The advantage of this method is that it involves very minimal code changes.

@iwasakims Hello, based on our previous discussion about the method of introducing the parallel compilation patch, can we decide on a suitable plan? Then, I will proceed with subsequent testing based on this plan.

@JiaLiangC 
> We could save the mvn patch file in the template directory. For components that support concurrent compilation, we can simply copy it over.

It would be nice if this can cover both rpm and deb. I prefer directly generating the maven.config patch (in package.gradle from string template) to modifiying a file with regex.


> To determine which components support concurrent compilation, we might need to add an attribute in the bigtop.bom file to mark those components that support this feature.

I think just using `project.hasProperty('compileThreads')` as done in current patch would be enough with comments (and commented out defaults) in bigtop.bom.

@JiaLiangC How about `maven_parallel_build = True` prefering opt-in style and following [the name of the feature](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/Parallel+builds+in+Maven+3)? Parallel processing seems not to be limited to compilation based on your experience.

@iwasakims  If you mean just simply changing the label name from maven_parallel_compile to maven_parallel_build, in the style of https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/Parallel+builds+in+Maven+3, then of course that's better.
test it on centos-7 and ubuntu-22.04

Building Hadoop and dependencies succeeded without docker on x86_64.

Deploying Hadoop by Puppet via docker provisioner failed due to unsatisfied dependency. It should be addressed in follow-up JIRAs.

```
Error: /Stage[main]/Hadoop::Common/Package[hadoop]/ensure: change from 'purged' to 'latest' failed: Could not update: Execution of '/usr/bin/dnf -d 0 -e 1 -y install hadoop' returned 1: Error: 
 Problem: conflicting requests
  - nothing provides /lib/lsb/init-functions needed by hadoop-3.3.6-1.el9.x86_64 from Bigtop_0
```

LGTM overall pending a nit. Thanks for the contribution, @cwseys.

That's fine, thanks @kevinw66

I got protobuf related error on smoke-tests of Tez. I'm looking into the cause.

```
java.lang.IllegalAccessError: tried to access field com.google.protobuf.AbstractMessage.memoizedSize from class org.apache.tez.dag.api.records.DAGProtos$ConfigurationProto,
```

While hadoop uses [shaded protobuf](https://github.com/apache/hadoop-thirdparty/tree/trunk/hadoop-shaded-protobuf_3_23) now, [Hadoop 3.3.6 retains dependency on protobuf-java-2.5.0 for compatibility](https://github.com/apache/hadoop-thirdparty/tree/trunk/hadoop-shaded-protobuf_3_23) and the protobuf-java-2.5.0.jar is in the classpath. Since [TEZ-4363](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TEZ-4363) upgraded the protobuf to 3.21., Tez must use its own protobuf-java-3.21.1.jar.

@Akanksha-kedia 
I have submitted some changes to another branch of your repository. I tested the RPM packaging and installation, which now supports deployment via Ambari. There are still some things that need to be done, such as adding smoke tests for Trino and including JDK 17 installation in the Bigtop tool chain. These will take some time.

> While working on adding pkgSuffix and parent directory to BigTop DEBs,

@JiaLiangC I am confused by your description. This PR is not for just refactoring only? If this fixes is for DEBs, why you paste the result of RPM packaging?
@MacChen01 I could not reproduce the build failure reported on [BIGTOP-4082](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-4082). Could you try the build after removing cached old images?
@MacChen01 Sorry, I can reproduce the issue now. Please update the patch to make tags including `-` available.

[provisioner/docker/config_openeuler-22.03.yaml](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/blob/0fbaaa90859a889dbd86b869895224fb7126f677/provisioner/docker/config_openeuler-22.03.yaml) should be renamed to config_openeuler-22.03-lts-sp1.yaml and it should refer to `bigtop/puppet:trunk-openeuler-22.03-lts-sp1` as required image.

The patch seems to break DEB packaging:

```
> Task :ranger-sdeb FAILED

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* Where:
Script '/home/iwasakims/srcs/bigtop/packages.gradle' line: 515

* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':ranger-sdeb'.
> Could not get unknown property 'FULL_PARENT_DIR' for object of type org.gradle.process.internal.DefaultExecAction_Decorated.
```

@iwasakims 
I apologize for the confusion. This PR has two objectives:
1. To refactor the parent directory and package suffix logic for RPM packaging.
2. To add logic for the parent directory and package suffix for DEB.

While working on the second point, I realized that referencing the existing logic for RPM's parent directory and suffix would result in a lot of duplicated code and make it difficult to understand. Hence, I refactored it.

you should have separated the PRs. Mixing refactoring and new feature makes review difficult. The behavir should not changed by refactoring while adding feature change behaviour.
